meanings.definition: Relating to or serving as a probation.
meanings.sent1: The probationally period for new employees is usually six months.
meanings.sent2: The judge made a probationally decision to allow the defendant to remain free until the next hearing.
meanings.sent3: The probationally arrangement for the student felt like a trial run for the real job.
meanings.sent4: Her probationally status in the company was like being on probation in a new role.
meanings.sent5: The probationally nature of the contract made it easy to terminate if needed.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is provisional or temporary.
meanings.sent1: She agreed to work probationally until a permanent position opened up.
meanings.sent2: The team decided to proceed probationally until they had more information.
meanings.sent3: He sang probationally at the karaoke night, unsure of his vocal skills.

meanings.sent5: The artist painted probationally, testing out different styles before committing.
